ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] seed transformations
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi Tom, First of all, you should definitely care about this kind of discrepancies. It is very important that all reports are accurate and that they make sense.

Hi Tom,

First of all, you should definitely care about this kind of discrepancies. It is very important that 
all reports are accurate and that they make sense.

> I'm trying to wrap my head around the following observations about the
> seeds in a crawl I did.
> 
> - The original seed list has 280 URLs.
> 
> - The seed list after the crawl died (the cause since fixed in HEAD)
>   has 304 URLs.
> 
> - The WUI seed report contains 300 URLs.
> 
> - If I extract the seeds from the crawl.log (by taking entries with an
>   empty discovery path) there are 277 URLs.
> 
> Now, when I examine the original seed list I found that there are 3
> URLs that are syntactically invalid. There is one that has a host name
> which is capitalized, and which gets rewritten to lowercase.

This make sense, since by chewing on crawl.log you got 277 URLs + 3 invalid URLs which is same as 
280 original seeds.

> Most confusing is the difference between the seed report and the
> crawl.log --- where did the 23 URLs go?

Seeds added due redirects will have a discovery path. That is why you missed them in your crawl.log 
pass.
I usually add a comment at the end of the seed list # END OF SEEDS.
After the crawl starts all new seeds due redirects will be added after the comment and it easy to 
distinguish them from the original seeds.

> I understand that the redirects get added to the seed list, and this
> accounts for the 304, mostly. (Actually I can account for 303 this
> way.)

This might be a bug where a new line, comments or something else is counted as seed. We will have to 
check this one.

Take care,
i.
